title: Is the absence of existence non-existence? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s generally very hard, and possibly fruitless, to talk about existence as if it was a category of an attribute. A better question tends to be something like - how does this thing exist? Because if something didn’t exist at all, we could talk about it. (It has to exist at least as an idea)
If you are belong to those people who believe that absence of light is called dark. Then yes, it is no wrong to say the absence of existence is non-existence.
